description._content: Photographer: Unknown, Non-Indian Subject: David Sinclair, Non-Indian        Charles O. Turbyfill (Charles Orr Turbyfill), Non-Indian, 1888-1966        Museum of the American Indian, Research Branch (Annex), 1926-1989 Date Created: October 1936 Catalog Number: P19170 Format: Albumen print Dimensions: 4.5 x 6.5 in. Collection History: Presumably commissioned by George Heye to document the early work of the Museum of the American Indian. Description: From L: Charles Turbyfill (1888-1966, MAI staff member) and David Sinclair, custodian, posed in front of partially covered wooden framework of the Hidatsa earth lodge in course of construction on Research Branch grounds, Museum of the American Indian/Heye Foundation, with fence and apartment buildings in the background Place: Research Branch, Museum of the American Indian/Heye Foundation; New York City, Bronx, Pelham Bay; Bronx County; New York; USA Site Name: Research Branch, Museum of the American Indian/Heye Foundation Culture/People: Minitari (Hidatsa),Non-Indian Culture Hierarchy: Northern Plains>Minitari (Hidatsa) Persistent URL:http://www.americanindian.si.edu/searchcollections/item.aspx?irn=306684 Repository:National Museum of the American Indian View more collections from the Smithsonian Institution.
